website_summaries.verdict: A beautiful option, that offers a modern look and practical features including a timer for your lighting.
pros: Lighting system comes with a timer with both daytime and nighttime settings
Filtration chamber is built into the aquarium
cons: In order to use the hinged hood, you need to put this tank a couple of inches off the wall

customer_reviews.title: Split down the side, without being touched.
customer_reviews.text: Getting ready this morning & the aquarium split down the right front side on the rounded edge. Nobody touched it. I was shaving in the bathroom. If I was not home, or if I was asleep this would have been extremely problematic. Luckily I saved my fish & my apartment. So warning to all buyers. I have had my tank maybe a year.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Alruqim

customer_reviews.title: Loving My Biocube!
customer_reviews.text: My Biocube 16 has only been up and running for 3 months but so far, I am thrilled with the results. I have not made any modifications to mine. I am approaching my Reef experience with a "Keep It Simple,Stupid" attitude. I do a 10% water change every 1-2 weeks and try to avoid "tinkeritis." So far, so good. I highly recommend for anyone who wants to get into Reef keeping but wants to keep things simple and low-cost.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia G. Nix

customer_reviews.title: Garbage is garbage.
customer_reviews.text: This contraption is highly overrated and not worth the money. Impossible to get the filter tree out since the maker glued in the rear bulkhead wrong. Forget lining up the removable filter strip since it's a bum fit built that way. The cooling fan for the lights sounds like the garbage truck is in front of my house and the stand is a wobbly piece of junk made out of particle board... get it wet and it explodes. I could have bought a conventional tank and been way better off but no, I had to deviate from the tradition... stupid me.
customer_reviews.author: Paladin

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: Got the tank set it up everything g worked fine shut it down 2 months later due to fish death set it back up 6 months later and the lights do nothing but flash like a strobe light an aquarium tech cane out and said it needs a new ballast and amazon won’t help me at all with this issue and to replace the hood with the lights is almost as expensive as the entire package
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tank cracked after 17 months - do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Our tank cracked down the top front right hand seam at 17 months. This happened in in the middle of the night so I woke up to water pouring out of the light fixtures in the kitchen and a huge mess. There are other 1 star reviews with similar issues so I would highly recommend not buying this tank as it has an apparent known design flaw that is not being addressed.
customer_reviews.author: Erika L. Hamrick

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tank for beginers and experts!
customer_reviews.text: I got mine 2ish weeks ago, bought life rock and put my first fish in 4 days ago. The tank is phenomenal, plenty of space I chamber 1 for my heater and coralife nano skimmer which works great. LED lights are great and the timers are easy to use. The fan noise people complain about is there (took a week before mine started being noisy) but I'm going to replace it with a computer silent fan and it won't be a problem. The fan noise is the only issue with this tank and since you get an amazing tank for a great price I'm not going to knock a star off for an easy diy fix.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: I was super impressed with all the improvements in the new Biocube
customer_reviews.text: I have owned the "old" Biocube with the CF lighting for several years. Was time to upgrade. I was super impressed with all the improvements in the new Biocube. The LED lighting and built in timers are awesome...and the unit runs whisper silent now, unlike the old fan that cooled the CF lights. In fact, I like this unit so much I'm thinking of buying a second one to keep in my office at work.
customer_reviews.author: andrew penko

customer_reviews.title: Cracked tank!!!
customer_reviews.text: The tank was beautiful till we came home one afternoon after school and found it had cracked and water was all in our floor!!!!! Not happy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: WARNING!!! Cracked for no reason
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tank less than six months ago. Just came home to a crack all the way up the side and 30 gallons of water on the floor. Perfectly fine when I left and no reason it should’ve cracked. It is really frustrating to spend so much time and money and have it all go down the drain-LITERALLY. Not happy with this purchase at all.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Mcdaniel

customer_reviews.title: Your small fish will not survive the filter
customer_reviews.text: I would not buy this tank if you want to keep a small school of fish such as tetra or danio. They are too small and will be swept up over the filter. In my opinion a design flaw as the plastic slats leading to the first chamber are too wide. So far I have been disappointed by many fish mortalities.
customer_reviews.author: Teisha Shiozaki

customer_reviews.title: Leaked right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Biocube 32 leaked as soon as put water in it. Couldn't find any cracks or splits. Seemed to be leaking from right rear lower corner.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Great looking tank
customer_reviews.text: Nice modern looking aquarium. The lights are a little tricky to program but, other than that, it's really nice. If I had to purchase again, I would buy a larger tank but, for the size it is fine. The lid lifts the whole way up so, maintenance is fairly easy. Fish seem happy.
customer_reviews.author: Kim D.

customer_reviews.title: FOWLR Only or be prepared to spend another 400 on Lighting
customer_reviews.text: The PAR rating for the LEDs isn't high enough for anything photosynthetic. If you want a coral or anemone like you see in the photo, the only option is Steves LED and its almost $400
customer_reviews.author: DaBoomer

customer_reviews.title: no biological filtration included
customer_reviews.text: this is not a complete kit since after it arrived I had to order biological filtration not included. for it to be a true kit it should be able to set up and go not oh by the way you have to decide what kind of filtration you want and provide it. They should make you aware that bio balls shown on the picture are not included in the kit also this does not have an adjustable return as advertised the lighting is lousy i definately am sorry i purchased this. the jbl nanocube is much nicer with excellent lighting and all the filtration is included. as for coralife DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: kprien

customer_reviews.title: Great for an All-In-One Nano Reef
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Biocube after I had the original Biocube 14. The Biocube 16 LED is significantly better for a nano reef. You can keep most LPS/Softies, and some folks are keeping SPS near the top of the tank. Light output is pretty good stock, and I see no personal need to upgrade it. Timer function is great as well once you dial it in. This is a great sleek All-In-One Tank.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mike

customer_reviews.title: Love this thaaang
customer_reviews.text: This looks really nice, has a robust filter system, and really awesome lights. The lights take some learning to setup but when you get it going, it is really easy to use. I did end up blocking off the bottom layer of the middle vents in the back since even though they're made for emergency overflow, it was constantly letting water drain into my bio-filter completely passing my mechanical and carbon filter cartage. Besides that, it has been working great for about half a year with fresh water.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade from the 29 Biocube
customer_reviews.text: Great upgrade from the 29 Biocube, the fan runs a little loud I must admit though. May look into getting a replacement for that.
customer_reviews.author: Layla Simons

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner tank
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is a salt water tank enthusiast....so for mother's day, I got a Coralife biocube! So far, I really enjoy it. It looks stylish, and everything seems to running perfectly. I haven't added a whole lot of sea life to it yet....but when I get it up to snuff, I'll post a picture.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie. H

customer_reviews.title: When she gets bored it will make an awesome seahorse
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised. I bought this for my wife. I have several reef tanks and she wants a fresh water for herself. Simple to get running and decent lighting. When she gets bored it will make an awesome seahorse tank
customer_reviews.author: Richard Elliott

customer_reviews.title: How do you clean out the mechanical filter section? ...
customer_reviews.text: How do you clean out the mechanical filter section? If substrate, small fish, and/or pieces of plants get into the bottom intake it's impossible to clean it without tearing the compartment apart. Also, the speed on the pump cannot be adjusted.
customer_reviews.author: A. Gideon

customer_reviews.title: I love it!!
customer_reviews.text: There’s a lot of reviews saying they break. And I’m sure there’s a select few that do but just inspect your biocube when it arrives very closely. If there’s any cracks I’d definitely ship it back. But on the other hand, if there’s no cracks this tank is amazing! The lights are ok. It does a great job with softies, and low light lps corals. Definitely wouldn’t recommend sps corals unless they’re positioned at the top of the tank. (This is with the stock lights) The filter is by far one of the easiest to clean and use. The biocube in my personal opinion is a nice middle range price for a nano tank. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Nice tank
customer_reviews.text: Works well for a start up tank but hard to work in the back not enough space for your hand to fit in to put in sponges.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Ash

customer_reviews.title: Great for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: This is a great starter system for beginners. If you just want fish, rocks, and soft corals you can't really go too wrong with this system. If you are looking to really grow LPS or SPS you are going to need to get better lighting, and at that point a different tank setup might provide better options. If you are just looking to get into the hobby, this tank is a Great all-in-1 setup!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tank is beautiful and the company is AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: Tank is beautiful and the company is AMAZING. If you have ANY issue they WILL take care of it regardless of what needs to be done.
customer_reviews.author: Jared M.

customer_reviews.title: 2-3 year life max.
customer_reviews.text: Warning to customers. Had this tank 2 years and it randomly cracked at 2am. Left side like other reviews. Has not been moved or shut down. Some this with the material used loses its ability to retain water. Bio cube 29 cracked top to bottom on the front left corner. Horrifying sound at 2 am and potential tank loss and floor loss if you are not aware. Be sure to keep the tank in a place when it does crack no if it will. They crack.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great looking aquarium with one small problem.
customer_reviews.text: I love the way it's a self contained set, but my order didn't have the sponge filter included in the box. The shippbox had been opened and inspected in transit so I don't know exactly where/how the sponge got lost but now I guess I have to pay to replace it before I can run the aquarium.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I've been watching this item for about a year because I wanted and needed a larger aquarium for my growing fish. Set up was easy, but be forewarned, you do need to purchase whatever media strata you want to use because it doesn't come with it. Other than that, I am very pleased with my purchase, as are my fish! Purchased the cabinet also and it looks real nice. Love the lights and how easy they were to set.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Grits

customer_reviews.title: Great Tank for Beginners Love it! Plan on buying another...
customer_reviews.text: Love this Tank, We have had Smaller nano's before. The Lighting is great works perfect! Fish and coral are doing great! Reinforced the stand to handle the weight.. Have had no Glass Cracking issues or lighting issues at all.. I think most Beginners will be happy with this tank. We plan on buying another soon .. Thanks ! Year later and Two Tanks still having great results .. but a lot of having a great salt tank is up to you.. stay on top of the parameters and do water changes..
customer_reviews.author: Robert Brunson

customer_reviews.title: Really nice setup and convenient with everything that you would need
customer_reviews.text: Really nice setup and convenient with everything that you would need to start up a fish tank regardless fresh or marine. easy to maintain and crystal clear glass for better vision. love the design. Everything is hidden from the back and in the cabinet of the tank. Come with many optional extras where can meet your need for each purpose. Cons: Extras could be expensive and can't not use after market products for many options.
customer_reviews.author: Steven H

customer_reviews.title: Good aquarium. Perfect starter tank for new comers. But may purchase somewhere else new.
customer_reviews.text: Great little starter tank. Easy to set up. The only thing I didn’t like is the Kohl’s return paperwork inside the box letting me know it wasn’t new unopened but most likely a returned item. All barcodes on box were cut off. I would have felt way better receiving a new unopened unreturned bio cube.
customer_reviews.author: D Mercer

customer_reviews.title: Great for a first tank
customer_reviews.text: My second biocube and while they have improved they still are fairly hard to clean in some areas. It's just hard to get my hands on the back to clean filter sponge or service the pump.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great tank
customer_reviews.text: This is easily the best and most well thought out tank I've ever owned. Filtration and heating are completely hidden in the three chambers in the back. One of the things that always annoyed me about other tanks I've owned is the constant sound of splashing water. This tank is completely silent while still having strong water movement in the tank itself. The lighting is good enough for corals, too, which is a huge bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Justin B.

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Just loved this little system, very easy to maintain and clean, the biggest problem was the protein skimmer, which was not very efficient. I recommend buying a over the side skimmer than can be placed in the back when you take the cover off and expose the back plumbing, not great for delicate corals but will maintain some, be sure to buy the additional lights that fit into hood.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome. Set it up
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Set it up, and simply clean the filter. I love it and so do my fish/corals!
customer_reviews.author: Matty

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not happy after spending so much money pump is weak ,doesn’t clean the water
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: I love this aquarium
customer_reviews.text: I love this aquarium. It is very easy to set up and use. I had a small issue with hearing the water running and then I realized that I need to fill up the back chambers as well. It is very quiet and my fish are doing great.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Delivery  !!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect tank for freshwater and of course saltwater with modifications. I could not say enough good things about delivery. They delivered it right outside of my apartment door and they even rang the door bell so i don't miss it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex A

customer_reviews.title: Great reef tank setup in medical office
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Biocube and the upgrade is significant especially with the LED lighting system and built in timer. I have a reef setup and my upgrades were the InLine media tower and Power Head pump to augment circulation. This produces an adequate and cost effective way to maintain an attractive system that my patients comment on nearly every day.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence B.

customer_reviews.title: Great set up.
customer_reviews.text: I am really enjoying this tank, I did have troubles putting the stand together 2 right sides. After talking to Amazon the problem was resolved. I have upgraded the pump and made mod on the filtration system. I had tried another nano tank and spent at least 3 times more, and it was horrible to take care of. For beginners this is a great set up.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Connelly

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: Leak right out the box. Ridiculous, will never buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Find a good fish store and do your research for the best results.
customer_reviews.text: Omg this tank was so easy to get up and going. I have nothing but good things to say about the bio cube 32. I love the light settings, the all in one with that fill Traicion on the back of the tank.
customer_reviews.author: William penfield

customer_reviews.title: Not like when I first hand a fish tank - High tech
customer_reviews.text: An amazing all in one aquarium. Filtration and lighting are a whole new way of creating a perfect balance for your fish. Customer service from vendor was outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: mark mendelson,mark mendelson

customer_reviews.title: Fish aquarium
customer_reviews.text: Nice tank and good pricing everything in Amazon is good.prices
customer_reviews.author: jon f.

customer_reviews.title: great buy
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for a friend. He has a ton of experience with coral aquariums. He says it is one of the best tanks he has had yet. He loves it and so does his clown fish.
customer_reviews.author: Squirrel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent starter tank...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent starter tank for the beginner. All incorporated, LED lighting is sufficient for many soft corals. Great price at $229. Easy to operate easy to clean. Suggest getting cheap timers for the lights so you don't have to remember turning them on and off. Don't let the reef heads turn you off as this is the easiest way to get in the salt water game without spending a fortune.
customer_reviews.author: Todd B

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic! - Keep in mind
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! - Keep in mind, there are two other UV sockets that don't come with the UV lights. The top is easy to remove with patience. Beware of opening top as condensation/evaporation drips down off of the top and behind the tank, have a towel ready.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Frost

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and looks great
customer_reviews.text: This aquarium is perfect if you want a low maintenance, easy to use, small aquarium to start with saltwater. Lights are excellent, I even put a kessil 360 blue over it and decided I like the stock lights better. Filter design is clever.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J Morris

customer_reviews.title: Split down side, I was at work.
customer_reviews.text: Split down side, just like Yoseph Alrupim said. Don’t get something just because it has 4 stars, I had it for 21/2 months.
customer_reviews.author: David Shaughnessy

customer_reviews.title: best bang for buck
customer_reviews.text: had running for 3 months, works well. i did go onyoutube and make the modifications others have to this when i started ( removing bio balls, inserting 2 sponges, putting in matrix carbon etc) really like the simplicity , i bought this to replace and doengrade from 55 gal das tank.
customer_reviews.author: am

customer_reviews.title: Great little tank!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second biocube. This new style is absolutely great! Shipping from Amazon was super fast!
customer_reviews.author: Remmy the Knife

customer_reviews.title: Great nano tanik
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife as a gift and she loves it. Within one month she has almost covered all the life rock with soft coral. Many were from her larger tank which she took fragments of the coral. It's easy to maintain, but I'd recommend getting the Coralife skimmer with it. Also order bioballs at the same time. The lighting is great too.
customer_reviews.author: James Campbell

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: One Of The best all in one systems out there. I even have acropora growing with the stock lighting!
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Bates

customer_reviews.title: Nice little tank
customer_reviews.text: Very nice little tank. Wish chamber in back was a little larger to handle my protein skimmer. LED lights are great.
customer_reviews.author: Mack McGilvrey

customer_reviews.title: Disaster-Cracked within 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Came home to a completely cracked tank with all fish and expensive coral dead. Not to mention the 30+ gallons of water all over. Would not recommend at all.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Wysocki

customer_reviews.title: A lot of improvements.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second biocube. The lighting package has definitely improved. I love it...
customer_reviews.author: lori pontello

customer_reviews.title: I love the set up BUT
customer_reviews.text: It's not 29 gallons like they have listed. I counted today as I was refilling it and it's only 20 1/2 gallons. I mean that's not a huge difference but still false advertising.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: lights are trash compared to Steve’s leds Expensive upgrade but it’s worth it for salt water
customer_reviews.text: Awesome great tank actual water consumption after live rock is about 22 gallons for my case: You still need to order a protein skimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Devin L.

customer_reviews.title: Beautful, But Smaller Than Expected
customer_reviews.text: A great tank that looks beautiful in our living room. The only thing that disappointed me was that it is too small for many species of salt water fish, and can only handle 2-3 small fish and some invertebrates before you've exceeded the bioload. But maybe I should have known this going into a 29 gallon tank....Anyways, we have 2 clownfish, a fairy wrass, and several invertebrates who seem quite happy in the tank.
customer_reviews.author: NinaGrey

customer_reviews.title: Pretty awesome nano tank
customer_reviews.text: Pretty awesome nano tank. Easy to set up easy to use and maintain. All in one tank looks great. You can leave the lights and filtration as is or use one of the many mods. Great for 1st timer
customer_reviews.author: Darin M

customer_reviews.title: Great support
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with service. Tank light didn’t work at first. Customer service walked me through a couple of things to check and then priority shipped new power supply.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this tank. I was able to set up as a reef tank.
customer_reviews.author: Johann Pond

customer_reviews.title: Only problem is heat!!
customer_reviews.text: Only problem is heat!! It produces a truckload of heat I'm having to install a media basket to free up room to put in a chiller
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Taylor

customer_reviews.title: My precious...
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! If I could do it all over, I would of gotten this cube in the first place. I'd rather have 5 of these than 1 large tank. You will seriously love this. Things that can use improving: Here is what I did. Gutted the stock lights, got some new lighting from 21led. Could also cut a small circle hole in top and have a kessil shine in. Would recommend getting a stronger small pump. The stock one is decent but a little weak. Don't use the coralife cartridges on top LOL they suck. Just use filter floss and change weekly. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Very nice home for my fish.
customer_reviews.text: So far love this tank! All in one unit makes everything very nice looking. Just wish they would drop the pricing on the cabinets, since the pricing dropped on the tanks.
customer_reviews.author: Remy Medranda

customer_reviews.title: Great tank
customer_reviews.text: Great tank with fantastic lighting. Have had it running for almost 3 months now with no issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: Neven Laprade

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great tank. Easy set up & care. No problems. Have had running for 4 months
customer_reviews.author: Don Luca

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best aquarium I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best aquarium I've ever had. Beautiful self contained system and easy to maintain. Visitors are highly impressed by it's look and style.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Am new to the salt water hobby so this is a great beginner tank
customer_reviews.author: Russell Haston

customer_reviews.title: Biocube 32
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine on Jan 18, it’s now august 15tg and the fans on it are starting to be loud
customer_reviews.author: Nathan G.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent all-in-one with room to grow
customer_reviews.text: I love this tank. The built in three chamber sump in the back is great and really allows a clean, convenient tank. The included media rack allows flexibility for the 2nd chamber (can run media, custom ATS, refugium, etc). The LEDs and programmability are really nice for this price point of an all-in-one tank. I wasn't sure about the frame and lid given the popularity of rimless tanks but so far I really like it. The lid really reduces any sound and evaporation. It will also help with dartfish and some others that might like to jump out. Overall, a very well thought out package.
customer_reviews.author: R. Krause

customer_reviews.title: Great choice for a tank.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best tank! It works great and looks awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Granolaguy 618

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good product but the return pump does have an annoying rattle to it.
customer_reviews.author: Henri

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love the design and simplicity of this, hope it works out for the long term.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Swope

customer_reviews.title: Product was shipped perfect and setup with no issues
customer_reviews.text: Product was shipped perfect and setup with no issues. It's been up and running for a few weeks with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Michalski

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Had the biocube up for a bit now. Works great! Pump is nice and quite and its easy to find good products that are made just for the biocube.
customer_reviews.author: ryan raftevold

customer_reviews.title: Great starter tank.
customer_reviews.text: this is a great starter aquarium. As is, fish only tank. Made several modifications to add coral.
customer_reviews.author: TylerT

customer_reviews.title: Great look but loud
customer_reviews.text: This is extremely nice and looks amazing. Butttttttt: For some reason the fans are extremelyyyyyy loud and I can't seem to figure out why they're so loud... anyone have any tips and if not can the manufacturer send me something to help this...
customer_reviews.author: Marjie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this small starter unit. Just what you need for your first steps into saltwater aquarium.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Sandlin

customer_reviews.title: I had a conventional 29 rectangle with a large intense pendant LED and my softies are doing much better now than they did then
customer_reviews.text: Had it for 6 months now and it is doing well. I had a conventional 29 rectangle with a large intense pendant LED and my softies are doing much better now than they did then. The light is a little anemic though they should have gone ahead and put a third buld in and upped the wattage. But this is a great tank as is and most people love the softies.
customer_reviews.author: kaeote

customer_reviews.title: Want to start saltwater? This nano is your answer
customer_reviews.text: My first saltwater tank. I love this nano cube. I added a few items to this cube for better performance. I have been cycling this tank for about one month. Almost ready to add corals and fishes.
customer_reviews.author: Quan

customer_reviews.title: Good, not perfect
customer_reviews.text: A very tidy setup with far better control of evaporation than the Nano cube which we have also owned. However, does not come with as many accessories as the Nano cube (which includes a wave maker controller and two pumps) and it's cooling fans are noisier so ultimately I think the Biocube is more expensive once it is equipped to the level of the Nano cube. That said the tidier look and vastly lower evaporation rate has made the Biocube the lower maintenance and more pleasing reef aquarium for us.
customer_reviews.author: Litefever

customer_reviews.title: Great Tank and Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Tank is great, I love the new design with the media rack with the tank. The cooling fan is quiet along with the pump. The tank I was delivered was cracked by the shipper. I emailed MarineAndReef and they responded quickly and I was delivered a replacement tank in about a weeks time. This is a great setup for a beginner tank or someone limited on space.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Biocube 29
customer_reviews.text: Product delivered on time. I love my biocube. Comes with everything to start your mani reef.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Must Buy
customer_reviews.text: OMG AMAZING PRODUCT love I have a flownder and a clownfish aswelll as a star fish and I watch them every day in this awesome tank (Came with all parts in tact)😀
customer_reviews.author: C Shinski

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome aquarium. perfect for small areas, really a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Homedoer

customer_reviews.title: This a great PNP Aquarium
customer_reviews.text: This a great PNP Aquarium! Plus it has the updated LEDs but be careful though the lights alone makes the tank quite hot. It almost crashed my system cause my chiller fan wasn’t working properly
customer_reviews.author: DieZeiL

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for beginner with saltwater. Can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.text: Great tank! perfect for anyone who is new to reef keeping. Very easy to setup. The only downside is the cooling fans are rather loud when the T5 lights are on. Some will say to ditch the bio balls but disregard that advice as they work fine.
customer_reviews.author: clb

customer_reviews.title: Biocube 29
customer_reviews.text: I give 5 stars because the manufacturer made good on the promise to replace the unit if not satisfied. It was cloudy after a couple of weeks, and the manufacturer promptly replaced the unit, which is now functioning to perfection.
customer_reviews.author: Sa

customer_reviews.title: Great for tropical tanks and live plants!
customer_reviews.text: What a great little aquarium. I bought it for my kids for Christmas. We are using it for tropical fish, so maybe it a little overkill. However we have real plants and they are absolutely thriving and growing fast with the LED lighting.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Molt

customer_reviews.title: Great tank
customer_reviews.text: I completely took this tank apart. I too all of the back filtration out and drilled the tank to put a 40 gallon sump under the tank. I like the way it looks. The lights work great. Again I looks fantastic and it's a great size.
customer_reviews.author: Zak

customer_reviews.title: 2 thumbs up!!!  ;-)
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had a chance to get it completely set up yet as i am waiting on my live rock, sand, salt and some accessories but i did fill it with water and plugged everything in for about an hour... everything seemed to work fine and didn't see any leaks so far... excited to get it up and running so till then ill give this 5 stars for fast delivery, quality product and great price!!! ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Mr Vigil

customer_reviews.title: The tank is nice once you get it fully intact
customer_reviews.text: ordered 2 of these, both came broken. Luckily I was able to find a nearby merchant with the same price. The tank is nice once you get it fully intact.
customer_reviews.author: Vance Hampton

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I ended up using it as a freshwater tank, will eventually convert to saltwater when I can afford it. The flow is a little high for freshwater but other than that everything else is perfect. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: one of the best things i every bought on amazon. its exatly like it said it was.......family is really happy
customer_reviews.author: thomas

customer_reviews.title: Lights won't work!
customer_reviews.text: The light module will not power on. I tested the power block on another piece of equipment, and it worked. So, it is the hood/light module that is defective. I tried the reset button with no success.
customer_reviews.author: Ravenmaniac

customer_reviews.title: not happy.
customer_reviews.text: My Biocube lights went out just 6 mouths old, very costly ! not happy.
customer_reviews.author: michael r britzman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: the absolute best tank ever. Comes with everything you need to get started. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Nea

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Very good tank with everything built in. I have had it for about 2 weeks. Absolutely loving it. The hood had a crack when i received it (probably during shipping). I contacted the customer service and received a new one right away! Will definetely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: darthAtma

customer_reviews.title: Excellent starter kit.
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect setup to start your saltwater/marine experience. I've had nothing but good results so far out of it. The lighting will cover soft corals and some LPS. I've learned so much. I am in search of a new lighting system to be able to grow sps and a clam. Super easy set up. If i have one complaint, i wish the skimmer, media and pump bays were a bit wider. I have to uses long pliers to be able to reach the bottom. My hand wont fit.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Jones

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice little aquarium. Great lighting options perfect for a nano reef setup.
customer_reviews.author: rxdude88

product_meta.title: Coralife LED Biocube Aquarium LED
product_meta.description: Size:Size 16The integrated 24-hour timer makes it easy to control the three independent channels: Bright white, sparkling blue and color enhancing LEDs for maximum beauty. Each BioCube also includes automatic 30 minute sunrise/sunset and 60 minute moonrise/moonset functions to replicate a natural day/night cycle. BioCubes are a great starter aquarium because they feature a compact and customizable filtration chamber that is already built-in to the back of the aquarium. Among other great features are the quiet submersible pump, dual intakes and adjustable return nozzle. Each aquarium is also 2" taller than the original BioCube aquariums, creating a larger viewing area with the new 16 and 32 sizes. Compatible with all existing BioCube accessories. Refer to the manual for troubleshooting steps.
feature_bullets: Sleek modern hood with vibrant LED lighting for freshwater to saltwater environments
Integrated 24-hour timer with three independent channels bright white sparkling blue and color enhancing LEDs
Automatic 30 minute sunrise/sunset and 60 minute moonrise/moonset functions to replicate natural day cycle
Compact and customizable built-in filtration – easy to setup and maintain
Quiet submersible pump dual intakes and adjustable return nozzle
Age Range Description: All Life Stages
Included Components: All Components included in Picture and Description
